page.title: 11Religion in Alresford.
page.content: There is only one type of religious establishment in Alresford, and this is St. Andrews Church (C of E). In 1971 the old church, St. Peters, was burnt down by vandals. St. Andrews was built in 1977. During the time when there was no church in the village, the church-hall was used for worship. In 1980 the present Rector came to the church, and since then it has been growing. The electoral role has risen from 45 members in 1980 to 123 in 1985. The church organises many of youth activities and weekly house groups, where members of the congregation meet for discussion and Bible study. Coffee mornings are organised every Friday morning, and youth groups such as Sunday School, Pathfinders and the Young Peoples Fellowship are organised on a weekly basis.
